title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-2.3 - Leave for qualifying exigency arising from the service of a family member in the armed forces of the United States
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 380-2.3 - Leave for qualifying exigency arising from the service of a family member in the armed forces of the United States

State Regulations
(a) Family leave benefits for an eligible
employee that are based upon a qualifying exigency as interpreted under the

Family and Medical Leave Act, 29 U.S.C. S 2612(a)(1)(e) and
29 C.F.R. 825.126(b)(1)-(9), arising
out of the fact that the spouse, domestic partner, child, or parent of the
employee is on active duty (or has been notified of an impending call or order
to active duty) in the armed forces of the United States, shall be paid for no
longer than the maximum periods of time as set out in section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law. (b) A claim for such benefits shall be made
and processed in the same manner as other claims for family leave
benefits. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
380-2.3

Adopted

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
